title: Worked Solution
text: No, events A and B are not independent in this scenario because P(A AND B) does not equal $$P\left(A\right) P\left(B\right)$$. In order for events A and B to be independent, P(A AND B) must equal $$P\left(A\right) P\left(B\right)$$. Since P(A AND B) $$=$$ $$0.1$$ and $$P\left(A\right) P\left(B\right)=0.25$$, A and B are not independent.
